Comments_List: The course provides an overview of financial crises, both from a theoretical and empirical perspective. The course covers both historical crises and the recent Global Financial Crisis, and highlights avenues for future research in the fields of financial crises and regulation.
Why we need safe assets and banking. How information affects the stability of the financial market.

I enjoyed the mix of theoretical and empirical work covered in the course. It was great to learn both about the empirical facts that characterize financial crises, and also to have a unifying theory of financial crises and how they emerge in the back of my head when thinking about empirical work. I learned a lot about the types of open questions that exist in the literature on financial crises.

Yes. I learned a lot about the field of financial crises and the work that has been done. I also learned a lot about how to think about financial crises and avenues for further research in the field, and more generally about macroeconomics. The course also helped transform the way that I think about financial intermediation and how the financial sector works, more generally.
